subject: Fwd: Password not generated in ActiveCampaign
preview: Casey   BLISS SUPPORT   e. support@tarabliss.com.au  w. tarabliss.com.au   Courage | Creation | Collaborative Leadership   doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'    Begin forwarded

full_threads.body:
Casey
BLISS SUPPORT

e. support@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au

Courage | Creation | Collaborative Leadership

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Begin forwarded message:

From: AM360 Support <amsupport@helpcenter360.com>
Subject: Re: Password not generated in ActiveCampaign
Date: 26 August 2019 at 6:34:33 pm AEST
To: support@tarabliss.com.au
Reply-To: AM360 Support <amsupport@helpcenter360.com>

Hi,

Apologies here is the image referred to in our previous response:

"We see you have ActiveMember360 on several sites.
Only one site will ever be used to generate the password. That site should always be available to perform that function.

Ideally in your case the site used to generate the password should be your live site https://tarabliss.com.au

However the attached image shows the sites using ActiveCampaign webhooks with ActiveMember360 when you submitted the ticket.

At the time the contact you refer to was created it is possible either of the sites 13.210.44.189 were generating the password. This may have caused your issue.

We have deleted all the webhooks within ActiveCampaign for ActiveMember360 apart from the one for https://tarabliss.com.au

We then tested and the password was generated without issue.

We suggest that you either deactivate ActiveMember360 on the 13.210.44.189 sites, or for each of those sites disable the webhooks. You do this within within WordPress admin for each site ActiveMember360, Webhooks.

If you are no longer using the staging site you should also do the same for that.

A password has now been generated for your contact: https://geeteepl.activehosted.com/app/contacts/13235"


Regards,

Norman

Your personal 'supporter' at ActiveMember360

Please take a second to rate my reply...

It was awesome It was OK It was bad

By clicking on any of the ratings links, you agree to Groove's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service

Bliss Support on August 25, 2019 at 11:26pm wrote:

Hi Norman,

Thanks so much for looking into this for us.

I didn't have the attached image you were referring to so I'm not sure what you mean about other websites generating the password.

Could you please clarify?

Thank you,

Casey
BLISS SUPPORT

e. support@tarabliss.com.au

AM360 Support on August 23, 2019 at 5:31am wrote:

Hi,
We see you have ActiveMember360 on several sites.

Only one site will ever be used to generate the password. That site should always be available to perform that function.

Ideally in your case the site used to generate the password should be your live site https://tarabliss.com.au

However the attached image shows the sites using ActiveCampaign webhooks with ActiveMember360 when you submitted the ticket.

At the time the contact you refer to was created it is possible either of the sites 13.210.44.189 were generating the password. This may have caused your issue.

We have deleted all the webhooks within ActiveCampaign for ActiveMember360 apart from the one for https://tarabliss.com.au

We then tested and the password was generated without issue.

We suggest that you either deactivate ActiveMember360 on the 13.210.44.189 sites, or for each of those sites disable the webhooks. You do this within within WordPress admin for each site ActiveMember360, Webhooks.

If you are no longer using the staging site you should also do the same for that.

A password has now been generated for your contact: https://geeteepl.activehosted.com/app/contacts/13235


Bliss Support on August 22, 2019 at 9:57pm wrote:

Hello, One of our contacts has not had a password generated as should be the case as triggered by an automation. Our Wordpress plugin was not updated until just today (we are in a transition with our web support which has meant that site updates have not been done) but it's not clear what isn't working. Can you please help?
